Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: “Early Years” (1947) and “Farewell” (1959). The first part depicts the Childhood days of Miyazawa as well as his later years when he helps out on his family’s farm, while also tending to numerous shop jobs to survive.

If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John Carroll as the title character. A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat-loving elderly neighbor, an evil crows nest on the property that may be home to an otherworldly entity, and nightmares involving flying cats and pagan sacrificed humans.
